page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The following pages are all about our 12 kilometre squares which consist of three small villages Catforth,Inskip and Wharles.All of our block contains farmland but one village is mainly residential and parts are occupied by a military defence base.There are 4 different types of farming round us: dairy farming,pig farming,poultry farming and crops.Of these dairy farming is most common.The military defence base is a radio station but some of the land is used by farmers to graze sheep. The nearest town is Preston.The land round here is very flat.The hedges are well kept and the fields vary in size.Because we are close to the west coast,the weather is often windy and wet but winters are fairly mild.
